headline: How big is a billion?
text: If you want to annoy a mathematician without investing much energy doing so, there's one question you can ask that will provide you with at least an hour of entertainment value: How big is a billion?   At first, this seems like a hair-splitting question that only big governments with giant war budgets or big banks with even bigger taxpayer-funded bailouts have to think about, but a billion is a number that has been redefined recently, and that has led to a bit of confusion as a result.  Two of our favourite mathematicians explain further:            [video link]  Which way were you taught? I was taught both the long and the short ways. Which means, of course, that I've been perpetually confused as to what is a billion, and I've especially been confused as to what the US National Debt is since it is referred to as "billions" or "trillions". After awhile, these words lose their shock value, and simply blend into the background of increasing poverty and financial despair. So I've always used scientific notation for large numbers because it was easier and less confusing.  .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. ..
